news_header: Southwest Airlines reported a profit of $261 million in Q4, reversing a loss from last year.
news_text: In Q4, Southwest Airlines Inc. earned $261 million compared to a loss of $252 million in the same period last year. The earnings per share (EPS) was $0.42, up from -$0.42 a year ago. Adjusted earnings, excluding items, were $356 million or $0.56 per share, surpassing analysts' expectations of $0.46 per share. Revenue for the quarter was $6.931 billion, an increase from $6.822 billion in the same quarter last year.
